boundary

Class Servlet

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.servlet.GenericServlet
      • javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
        • boundary.Servlet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, javax.servlet.Servlet, javax.servlet.ServletConfig

    @WebServlet(value="/Servlet")
public class Servlet
extends javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
    Servlet class. This class handles all requests and responses. It directly interacts with the controller class.
    Version:
    1.00, 5 Dec 2016
    Author:
    Connor Kirk
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      This method receives criteria through the HttpServletRequest object and uses it to narrow down the list of cars that will be processed and displayed using FreeMarker in the search.ftl file.

      This method receives an image through the HttpServletRequest object, calls for the logic layer to store it in the database, and prints a JSON object containing the image through the output stream to be parsed with jquery.

      This method receives a user id through the HttpServletRequest object and calls for the user's information to be processed by FreeMarker with the user.ftl file.

      • processRequest

        protected void processRequest(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                              javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        This methods processes the request of the user and redirects to the proper method. If their request is invalid, they are given a SC_BAD_REQUEST error.
        Parameters:
        request - Takes user's request. Gathers parameters
        response - Used for redirecting the user.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If there is an invalid request.

      • cancelRental

        private void cancelRental(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                          javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
        This method handles the request that a user want to cancel his or her car rental. This method gathers parameters and calls the logic layer to continue the request.
        Parameters:
        request - Stores the user's request and parameters.
        response - Used for redirecting the user.

      • verifyDates

        private void verifyDates(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                         javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
        This method is called by an AJAX method. It is given two dates as parameters. It then calls upon the logic layer to verify them. It returns whether they are valid as a bool.
        Parameters:
        request - An AJAX request from the user containing the date objects.
        response - Prints true if the dates are valid; false otherwise.

      • book

        private void book(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                  javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
        This method is called when a user wants to book a vehicle. The start date and end date are required as request parameters, as well as the id of the car being booked. This method does NOT create an entry of these items in the database. Instead, it routes the user to a payment page.
        Parameters:
        request - Request of the user containing dates and car id.
        response - Used for redirecting the user.

      • getUserRentals

        private void getUserRentals(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                            javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
        This method prints all information about a specific user from the rental_data table. It prints the rental information (booked from, to, and who is renting the vehicle) for all vehicle the user owns. It will also print all of the cars that the user has booked.
        Parameters:
        request - Request from the user. Only HttpSession is required.
        response - Redirects the user.

      • confirmPayment

        private void confirmPayment(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                            javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
        This method is called after a user has entered in payment information when booking a car. If the payment information is valid, a new entry well be created in the database with the given information. The user will then be routed to a confirmation page.
        Parameters:
        request - Stores the user's parameters and HttpSession.
        response - Redirects the user.

      • autoModel

        private void autoModel(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                       javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
        This method will typically be called through an AJAX request it calls the logic layer to get a list of car moedls that is filtered by the data sent by the request. This method then prints out the list of car models as a JSON object.
        Parameters:
        request - AJAX request from the client. Contains car model data.
        response - Used to print the car model list as a JSON object.

      • autoType

        private void autoType(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                      javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
        This method will typically be called through an AJAX request it calls the logic layer to get a list of car types that is filtered by the data sent by the request. This method then prints out the list of car types as a JSON object.
        Parameters:
        request - AJAX request from the client. Contains car type data.
        response - Used to print the car type list as a JSON object.

      • autoMake

        private void autoMake(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                      javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
        This method will typically be called through an AJAX request it calls the logic layer to get a list of car makes that is filtered by the data sent by the request. This method then prints out the list of car types as a JSON object.
        Parameters:
        request - AJAX request from the client. Contains car type data.
        response - Used to print the car type list as a JSON object.

      • calendar

        private void calendar(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                      javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
        This method is used to process a user's request where they want to view calendar for a specific car. The calendar must be able to display all the days that are already taken. thus must call the logic layer to get this information.
        Parameters:
        request - AJAX request from the user.
        response - Prints a JS formated string which contains the array of date objects.

      • upload

        private void upload(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                    javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
        This method handles the image upload request and directs the user's view to the upload.ftl template.
        Parameters:
        request - Stores the user's request and parameters.
        response - Used for redirecting the user.

      • uploadImage

        private void uploadImage(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                         javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
        This method receives an image through the HttpServletRequest object, calls for the logic layer to store it in the database, and prints a JSON object containing the image through the output stream to be parsed with jquery.
        Parameters:
        request - Stores the user's request and parameters.
        response - Used for writing output to be used with JQuery.

      • deleteImage

        private void deleteImage(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                         javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
        This method receives an image id through the HttpServletRequest object and calls for the car logic layer to remove it from the database. If the user is not logged in, they will be redirected to the login page. If they are not owners of the car, they will be redirected to the last page they visited.
        Parameters:
        request - Stores the user's request and parameters.
        response - Used for redirecting the user.

      • delete

        private void delete(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                    javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
        This method receives a car id through the HttpServletRequest object and calls for the car logic layer to remove the item from the database if the user has permission. If the user is not logged in, they will be redirected to the login page. If they are not owners of the car, they will be redirected to the last page they visited.
        Parameters:
        request - Stores the user's request and parameters.
        response - Used for redirecting the user.

      • edit

        private void edit(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                  javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
        This method receives a car id through the HttpServletRequest object. It allows the user to modify the car's entry in the database if they have permission. If the user is not logged in, they will be redirected to the login page. If they are not owners of the car, they will be redirected to the last page they visited.
        Parameters:
        request - Stores the user's request and parameters.
        response - Used for redirecting the user.

      • add

        private void add(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                 javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
        This method receives information about a car through the HttpServletRequest object. It allows the user to make a new entry in the database if they are logged in. If they are not logged in, they will be redirected to the login page.
        Parameters:
        request - Stores the user's request and parameters.
        response - Used for redirecting the user.

      • viewUser

        void viewUser(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
        This method receives a user id through the HttpServletRequest object and calls for the user's information to be processed by FreeMarker with the user.ftl file. If a user is trying to view his/her own page, additional capabilities (edit/delete) will be shown on car listings.
        Parameters:
        request - Stores the user's request and parameters.

      • viewCar

        void viewCar(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
        This method receives a car id through the HttpServletRequest object and calls for the car's information to be processed by FreeMarker with the car.ftl file. If a user is trying to view a car they own an edit button will be added to the page.
        Parameters:
        request - Stores the user's request and parameters.

      • search

        void search(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
        This method receives criteria through the HttpServletRequest object and uses it to narrow down the list of cars that will be processed and displayed using FreeMarker in the search.ftl file.
        Parameters:
        request - Stores the user's request and parameters.

      • register

        void register(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
              javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
        This method receives the information of a new user from the register.html page. If the username does not exist in the database, a new entry is made and the user's session is stored. If the username does exist, the user is redirected to register.html.
        Parameters:
        request - Stores the user's request and parameters.
        response - Used for redirecting the user.

      • login

        void login(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
           javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
        This method verifies that the information the user inputs in login.html is valid. If so, their user id is stored in the HttpSession and the user is routed to the last page they were on. If the information is invalid, the user is rerouted to login.html.
        Parameters:
        request - Stores the user's request and parameters.
        response - Used for redirecting the user.

      • logout

        void logout(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
            javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
        This method invalidates the user's session and routes them to index.html.
        Parameters:
        request - Stores the user's request and parameters.
        response - Used for redirecting the user.

      • processTemplate

        private void processTemplate(java.lang.String templateName)
        This method processes the given FreeMarker template with the 'root' map.
        Parameters:
        templateName - The name of the template to be processed.

      • getURL

        private java.lang.String getURL(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
        This method computes and returns the URL for a given request.
        Parameters:
        request - Stores the user's request and parameters.
        Returns:
        URL string

      • sendToLastPage

        private void sendToLastPage(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response,
                            javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session)
        This method redirects the user to the last page they visited (stored in HttpSession object).
        Parameters:
        response - Stores the user's request and parameters.
        session - The current user's session and contents.
